paper.title: 2025年6月英语六级听力真题（第一套）

questions.question_text: What did the woman do?

options.text: Met the computer technician.
Told the man about her trouble.
Called the man's company.
Visited Alpha Maintenance.

questions.question_text: What did the man say he had done?

options.text: Consulted someone in charge.
Came as soon as possible.
Informed the central office at once.
Designated an engineer to the case.

questions.question_text: What did the woman feel about the situation?

options.text: Frustration.
Intimidation.
Desperation.
Indignation.

questions.question_text: What are the speakers discussing?

options.text: Whether the contents have been backed up.
Whether they can find help somewhere else.
Whether all data stored on the hard drive has got lost.
Whether they need to wipe the system directories clean.

questions.question_text: What does the woman think of her job?

options.text: It's boring.
It's challenging.
It's a beautiful thing.
It's unlike most jobs.

questions.question_text: What is the woman's job?

options.text: Arbitrating between disagreeing solicitors.
Preventing disputes from escalating.
Buying and selling property.
Mediating land disputes.

questions.question_text: What does the woman say about courts?

options.text: Courts are intended for fixing major legal disputes.
Courts are getting too bureaucratic to function.
Courts can be frustrating and expensive.
Courts can be frightening and arbitrary.

questions.question_text: What skills does the woman think are important for her job?

options.text: The ability to make arguments in a unique way.
The skill of preventing conflicts between parties concerned.
The skill of foreseeing any potential stakes in their work.
The ability to express themselves clearly and forcefully.

questions.question_text: What did the recent studies do?

options.text: They looked into the relationship between one's prior knowledge and creativity.
They offered novel ways to help older adults to keep their memories from aging.
They proposed an explanation for old people's difficulty in retrieving memories.
They advanced a new model concerning human information storage and retrieval.

questions.question_text: What do the researchers find about older adults?

options.text: Young adults rely on memory while older adults keep notes as a reminder.
Older adults often retrieve irrelevant memories along with what they want.
Young adults accumulate knowledge much more quickly than older adults.
Older adults generally perform cognitive tasks much slower than young adults.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about older adults?

options.text: They show preserved, and sometimes enhanced, creativity.
They frequently suffer from disorderly crowded memories.
They can rely on their accumulated wisdom in an emergency.
They may well be served by forgetting their prior knowledge.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about workers?

options.text: They are actually proud of the goods and services they produce.
They are worried about being alienated from the outside world.
They are rarely in control of many things related to their work.
They are longing to share the profits made from their work.

questions.question_text: What is the downside of the Industrial Revolution?

options.text: The steady decrease in productivity.
The adverse effect on physical health.
The feeling of being time poor.
The rising economic inequality.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about automation?

options.text: It alters the structure of work.
It puts jobs and wages at risk.
It liberates people from tedious and laborious work.
It creates new work opportunities in the IT industry.

questions.question_text: What is important for workers' well-being according to the speaker?

options.text: Finding meaning in work.
Prioritizing life over work.
Improving relationships in the community.
Realizing one's social value in the workplace.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about grit?

options.text: Affect our attitude to novel tasks.
Distinguish us in the social world.
Outweigh IQ in importance.
Impact academic achievements.

questions.question_text: How could babies turn on the music player?

options.text: By pressing a hidden button.
By pushing a big button on top.
By pressing two buttons at the same time.
By helping the babies push the right button.

questions.question_text: What did the experiment show about babies?

options.text: Perform difficult tasks successfully just by observing how adults acted.
Make generalizable inferences about persistence from a few examples.
Adapt themselves to different social contexts.
Work hard to interact with experimenters.

questions.question_text: What is the speaker doing?

options.text: Offering advice on overcoming habitual lateness.
Exemplifying various recreational opportunities.
Scrutinizing individuals' defining traits.
Suggesting ways for setting priorities.

questions.question_text: What is recommended to ensure a timely departure in the morning?

options.text: Make the breakfast simpler.
Take the alarms seriously.
Ready yourself in the early dawn.
Get prepared the night before.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker advise us to do?

options.text: Finish the prior task 30 minutes earlier.
Keep ourselves from hitting a bump.
Leave time in between activities.
Try to avoid possible hold-ups.

questions.question_text: What do we learn about Proper Bostonians?

options.text: Their lifestyles vary.
Their traits vary.

questions.question_text: How do Proper Bostonians differ from Parisians and New Yorkers?

options.text: They are not as willing to help strangers.
They are not as patient with one another.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about Boston's traditional culture?

options.text: It was practiced by Boston's founding fathers.
It is not deemed exotic by Proper Bostonians.

questions.question_text: What does the speaker suggest Boston do?

options.text: Stick to its own way of showing courtesy to strangers.
Follow the examples set by Paris and New York City.
Learn from the world's major cities in promoting tourism.
Take pride in its history and adhere to its cultural tradition.
